title: Introduction to Structural Analysis (in Mechanics)
description:
Structural analysis is the determination of effects of loads on physical structures and their components. It employs the fields of applied mechanics, materials science and applied mathematics to compute a structure's deformation and other phuysical quantities.
There are three different methods to perform structural analysis:

1. Analytical Methods- A structural enginerr must know so information as structural loads, geometry, support conditions and material properties, etc. The formulation is based on the three fundamental relations i.e., equillibrium, constitutive and compatibility.

2. Strength of Materials Method: The mechanics of materials method is available for simpler structural members subject to specific loadings. Solutions can be superimposed to analyze a member undergoing combined loading.

3. Elasticity Methoods: These methods are available generally for an elastic solid of any shaape. The solutions are derived from the equations of linera elasticity. The equations of elasticity are a system of 15 partial differential equations.

title: Music, therapy for better health.
description:
Who Doesn't Love Listening To a sound Which Makes them Feel Calm And Let's them Enjoy Moments In Life? 
What If I Tell You That the Sound In Your Ears Is Making You Healthier? Only If You Like The Sound That Is Ofcourse. 

Music Is Also A Good Source Of Reducing Pain. I Mean Who Hasn't Felt Their Heart Lighten When A Song's Lyric Manages To Say What They Never Could. According To A Paper In The UK Based Journal Of Advanced Nursing, Music Can Reduce Chronic Pain From A Range Of Painful Conditions Including Disc Problems And Arthritis By Upto 21%. That's A Lot When You're Hurting. 

Also There Are Some Songs Which Take You Back To A Place Or Throwback You To A Memory, And Make You Feel It All Over Again. Ah, The Nostalgia. The Point Is, Music Aids You In Storing Memory Related To Certain Moments.

Scientifically Speaking, One Of The Healthy Effects Of Music Includes Reducing Blood Pressure. Just When You Think You're About To Transform Into A Red Coloured Tom With Smoke Coming Out Of Your Ears, You Might As Well Consider Turning On Some Sam Smith Or Whatever Makes You Feel better. 

I've Always Seen people  Literally Worshiping Music. If It Has Such Health Benefits, Maybe it Is Godly And It's Essence A Holy Grail.

title: Accepting Transsexualism
description:
Often questions like, "Do you accept transgender people?" are raised then and now. It's surprising how the society gives no second thought when it comes to classifying people. Being a transgender has not caused any harm to the society, which leaves us with no reason for not accepting them.  
But unfortunately, not everyone can have a rational mindset. There are people in the society who ridicule other people who are different from them. As a result of which, many transgender people face harassment at different levels. They are looked down on and isolated from the culture. It is the sad truth of our society that whosoever stands out is always at a greater risk of being attacked. Transgender people come from all walks of life. They are parents, daughters, sons, co-workers, your neighbors, actors, or anybody. They are humans with the same ambition as yours, emotions for their family and friends, and equally talented and deserving as any other person of this world. So why should there be any discrimination against them? For years transgender people have struggled for their acceptance to the society and acknowledgement to their identity. However, with so little development with their acceptance there are still many individuals, teenagers and children who are afraid to come in light and accept themselves to be different from rest of the crowd. The truth is, the process of transition is not tough but the road to self-acceptance is. It is important to explore all avenues and also have stable and grounded emotions to commence the journey of transition. 
But to achieve all this, transgender individuals require  Equality,support and acceptance from the society. If someone who is trying to get comfortable in its own skin is considered being unethical or immoral then the people of this world need to evaluate their moral code. 
Equality is deserved by each and every living being on this planet. And, fighting for greater equality for a particular section takes away nothing from us. We owe a lot more than acceptance to these individuals, and that is, a START. I'd

title: Genesis of Bio-Inspired Algorithms
description:
Humans have always learnt from nature. For a while now we are busy destroying it.
But finally, it seems we are returning to it as it has a lot to give than what meets to eyes.
The extensive use of Bio-Inspired algorithms gives a lot more effective results in solving optimizations  problems like Travelling salesman problem, Vehicle routing problem, Robot path planning and De novo drug design etc than traditional algorithms. 
These algorithms are fully inspired by the behavior of the creature around us. 
It may be inspired from:
i) The movement of an ant in search of food (used in Santa Fe trail)
ii) The colony of ant, where group of ants always form a shortest path between two points (used in Graphs to find shortest path between two points in space), called Ant Colony Optimization
iii) Behavior of monkeys to climb, jump and somersault between branches (used in Robot Path planning and vehicle routing problems), called Monkey Algorithm
iv) Decentralized group behavior of Swarms, where they always follow the group formed by many individuals to find either a path or food source (used in TSP or 8 queens etc), called particle swarm optimization. 
These algorithms can be either single objective or multi objective based on the type of problem one is solving. 
Bottom line is, the use of Bio-Inspired algorithms generate optimal solution and minimize time and cost with problems having humongous search space.

title: Regulating Home Schooling in India
description:
If you take a look to the syllabus and academic curriculum of  most of the Indian schools and universities, you'll find that it is filled with content which are completely job oriented or obsolete. There are very limited or no practical or alternate approach to anything. 
You have to study the same age old theory in a way the teacher or professor seems fit, or let us say in a way he/she might have learned. 
Don't you think it is high time to change this? Don't you think we should have a different approaches and methods to learn things? 
Instead of mugging up the multiplication table from 2 to 20, don't you think we should focus on teaching the coming generation, the technique of doing it, and who knows he/she might even go till 200.
There are parents who think that the content and the way that schools teaches are too traditional, skill oriented, and takes toll in the imagination and thinking power of a child. These parents refrains themselves from sending their kids to school and teach their kids at home, however it seems fit. 
The thing is, every child should have basic reasoning ability, imagination, and clear concept of things. How does it matters from where he/she gets it? Be it proper schooling or home schooling, the basic thing is a child should be ready to face life and have ability to make the most of it. The dream and ambition of a child should not be crushed under any circumstances.

There is no rule in India against homeschooling but it is not fully recognized as well. The RTE (Right to Education) law, does not recognize homeschooling. It is loosely written and does not cover the whole picture. Different lawmakers of different regions have their own views on homeschooling. 
I think homeschooling should be regulated and recognized by the government. RTE should be revised in favor of homeschooling.
Instead of making every kid industry ready, let the parents decide how they want to raise their kids. Maybe a child's focus is not in calculus, but instead prefers painting, or language, or acting. Who knows, maybe a child's dream is to be a lorry driver and to travel places. But again it raises the social stigma of 'these are not the jobs for educated', which again raises the question of 'difference between educated and literate'. Lets keep this tale for some other day.
Tell me what do you think about homeschooling, share your thoughts down below.

title: HACKING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
description:
HACKING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

There Are Two Different Types Of Hacking.

1. ETHICAL HACKING

2. UNETHICAL HACKING


Firstly, We Discuss About Ethical Hacking.  Hacking Is Nothing But To Take In Control Of Some Others Accounts Or Credentials. This Type Of Hacking I.e Ethical Hacking Is Not Illegal. Here We Wont Operate Any Shit From The Hacked Account. So People Can Learn These Types Of Hackings And Improve Their Skills So That It May Be Useful In Future To Defend Themselves.


Finally,Unethical Hacking. If We Operate Any Shit From That Hacked Account And Change Passwords Or Bloblob From That Shit, This Comes To Unethical Hacking. This Type Of Hacking Is Dangerous And Illegal. Cyber Crime Officers Can Easily Track You Where You Are, When You Hacked, From Where You Hacked Easily And Put A Case On You.

According To Section 43: Of Information Technology Act 2000. Whoever Destroys, Deletes,alters And Causes Disruption Of Any Computer With The Intention Of Damaging The Data Without The Permission Of The Owner Of The Account Or Computer Shall Be Liable To Pay Fine Upto 1 Crore To The Person Affected By Way Of Remedy


And There Are Also Some Sections Like Section 43A, Section 66 Deals With 'hacking With Computer System' Is Imprisoned For 3 Years And Can Be Extended Upto  2 Years.



So, Guys Be Careful While You Are Hacking. Dont Do Any Harm To Their Accounts Or Computers Without The Permission Of The Owner Of The Account Or Computer

title: MINI PROJECTS!!!!!!
description:
Especially for btech students


As we are engineering students we must achieve something in these four years. Every human brain has the capacity of 1 Exa Flop which is equivalent to billion billions of calculations per second. With these brain we can discover any huge discovery.

Atleast for the meaning of degree we take we must do it. Now I will explain about a small project.


MOBILE CHARGER:-

As we all know that our mobile takes only 5v supply but our mains are 220v or 230v initially to minimise the voltage from mains we must use stepdown transformer which converts 220V mains to 5V mains.    

Do you know that a charger consists of only 3 electronis components  transformer, rectifier, capacitors.

Yes, with these three components itself we are doing a charger now. 

A rectifier consists of four diodes which are connected in series parallel connection( refer in bridge rectifier). these are connected to capacitors and the output is given to mobile charger slot.


You can refer my page for any queries :- http://www.phani.skynova.io/

title: “We turn the cube and it twists us…..”
description:
The most congruous, statement proposed for the Rubik’s cube, well known as ‘the Magical cube’, by its inventor Architect Eron Rubik.

Rubik’s cube – it’s conspicuous that one would have had an interaction with it as a childhood toy. But this toy turns out to be the ultimate passion for a few in the thick of us. There is this fable about one in the thick of those.  There it goes ….

The first interaction of her with the cube was magical, might that she figured out why it was possibly known as the magical cube. She ruminated it to be the most interesting piece of work to put one’s hands on! She felt it to be so very alive in itself, heating up the hands, bolstering the zest of solving it, also, the enthusiasm she felt was over whelming.

Going down the memory lane, the very day when she started solving the cube, it was enormously frustrating, she had a tough time. Gosh! That poor thing was thrown down the wall, for not being able to get solved. There were these unseen connections she got to learn- that little cube was drilling in copious enlightenment! - The most glorious moments in life are not the so called days of the success but rather those days when out of dejection and despair we feel to rise in us the challenge to life, challenge to stand up- get that fervour out in the right direction and work on with heart & soul!

 While trying her hands on Rubik’s cube she unsolved some abstruse philosophies.  She metaphorically imitated the magical cube with the magical life. That the wheel of events go on and on, at times you solve the difficulties, at times it’s difficult to solve them. What matters much more is the expedition, than the destination. And the expedition ripens to be alluring when we take up our very own passion, where we breathe in, what our soul craves for!

Thereby, when we do what we love, the seemingly impossible becomes simply challenging, the labour becomes purposeful resistance, and the difficult loses its edge and is trampled eventually by our progress. And so did happen with her! She figured out the key to solve the magical cube! That her best time of solving the Rubik’s cube turned out to be 45 sec.

Life is a marvel! And the time we own is minimal. Thus, the most crucial thing is to enjoy it, to take up the ultimate passion, strive for it, possess that zeal to achieve it and keep on trying till our soul gets quenched! , as it is duly said by Sir David frost –

 “Don’t aim for success if you want it, just do what you love, believe in, and it will come naturally”

-          Master Hetal

title: ERUDITION OF ISSUES VENTURED BY 3RD GENDER
description:
In our social system, role and status of a gender rests upon the natural law of fertility and productivity. In no era society has ever respected infertility, it being labelled as a ‘curse’. Infertile are treated inhumanly, the ones who choose the ‘road not taken’! The trans genders are loomed over in the society and are deprived of their basic civil rights.

Gender is a discretion, there are as many gender identities as there are people, are unique all constantly being explored in conscious or unconscious ways. In the realm of immense progress, we mask ourselves in practicalities, but turm a blind eye towards this burning issue of trans genders being deprived of the acknowledgement in the society which precludes their progress and ambushes them in the vicious cycle of agony.

In the interim of cities being metamorphosed into metro cities, a few in the thick of us and not even deemed as humans!

title: AN INTERESTING & EMERGING FIELD!
description:
Not Many Know The Existence Of The Field,  "BIOINFORMATICS". The Field Emerged Somewhere Between 1960's-80's, But Gained Recognition Only After The Submission Of Sequence Of The  Human Genome In The Year 2003.  The Old Educational Tradition Of Opting Any Engineering Course (especially Computer Science) Or Medicine Or Commerce Is Still Being Followed In Certain Families. Well To Your Surprise, Bioinformatics Is The Blending Of All The Above Mentioned Fields In Some Or The Other Way. Though There Is A Lot About The Field To Be Known, Let Me Just Give A Brief Account On What It Actually Is. Bioinformatics Is An Interdisciplinary Subject Involving BIOLOGY, MATHEMATICS, MEDICINE, STATISTICS, PHYSICS And Lastly The Field That Rules The World Today, "COMPUTER SCIENCE". In Laymen Terms, It Is Dealing The Biological Data Using Computer Technology. 
For Better Understanding, Let Me Cite An Example: A Drug Has To Be Discovered To Cure A Disease, Say HIV. Using The Bioinformatics Tools Or Software Available One Can Study The Cause Of Disease At Genetic Level, Then At The Cellular Level, Molecular Level And The Hierarchy Goes On To Better Understand The Disease And Design An Effective Drug After Which The Whole Process Of Drug Discovery Starts. 
Computer Science Is The Mainstay Of The Bioinformatics Industry. It Plays A Role In  developing Tools That Could Meet The Needs, To Create Databases And  mainly In Developing Mobile Applications For A  particular Task. Building Of Mobile Applications Makes It Easier For The Scientific Community, Researchers, Students To Perform Tasks Like Sequence Alignment, Annotation Etc. Quickly At Their Convenience. 
There Is More Into Bioinformatics Which Can Be Learnt From Various Resources Available.
Let Me Conclude By Saying, There Are More New And Interesting Fields Emerging, Do Not Narrow Down Your Options.

title: Say yes to food and no to fat.
description:
Every 9/10 people say diet is the key to lose weight. Well I don't fully agree with it. You have got only one life to live, fearing weight gain would you stop eating delicious and mouthwatering yummy dishes. This becomes a challenging task for foodies. The basic formula is to burn calories. Eat whatever you like but make sure to burn them. Below mentioned are a few ways to follow to stay fit and healthy. 
1) Morning walk : 
Walk briskly for 45 minutes to one hour in the morning.
2) Drink lots of water.
3) Workout for an hour everyday:
Gym is not mandatory, if you feel like going to one good for you. Otherwise workout can be done at home.
Some of the exercises that can be done at home are listed below:
a) Aerobics
b)Wall push-ups
c)Lunges
d)Crunches
e)Butterfly-peck deck
f) Leg raises
g)Stretches
Perks of doing workout at home : Can be done at your own pace and comfort
The only thing to keep in mind is increase the number of repeats once you become comfortable with doing a particular exercise.
Note: Do it as slowly as possible at the beginning. 
Do not check your weight every now and then because the weighing scale shows you whole body weight which includes water in the body, organ weight and many other factors. 
Some people think sweating is a sign of burning calories. That is not true. Sweating depends on the body temperature, environment temperature and other factors like dehydration. Do not panic about not sweating while exercising.
Stay fit and happy. Do not give up on your love for food.

title: Education: A Basic Necessity
description:
The pen is a sword and so is a pen a key to a blaze full of dreams and desires. If you go past the casual streets of any city, town or village in India, sadly there would be at least one person, be it in the form of a housemaid, gardener, mechanic, stall worker, etc, who has never been amongst the walls of a school. Education to these people is limited to knowing the basic maths of calculating timely household budgets or words enough to sign their names on a legal document. Over the years there has been an increasing need of educated youth, but as the policies on education rises, the population rises too and the ratio of uneducated people yet remains the same.

This arises as a major challenge because one of the main nuances for a developed country is to have a knowledgable and intelligent population. According to All Global Monotoring Report (GMR) released in 2014 by UNESCO, India has the largest population of illiterate adults with a population of 273 million. This is 37 percent of the world's total. It accounts for the fact that the very major issue of the prevailance of poverty gets its roots from illiterate backgrounds. It is also furnishing Child Labour and other atrocities. About 11 million of India's children even in modern times are being stolen of the right to learn because their parents have no money to finance their education. Others are simply dropping out of school because of poor performance or are physically/mentally unstable. Further, circumstances are causing them to enter beggery and dangerously many of them are even entering the inveterate circle of drugs. These children are unable to be a part of the legitimate society that India should be holding in it in order to combat the modern phase. In turn, we are advancing at lesser pace compared to how fast we should be moving. 

As far as society and gender biasing is concerned, girls are still a major part of the uneducated globe with them constituting about 50 percent of the circle. This statistics includes all adults and younger ages. These girls are getting married off and are being made to set households. Female foeticide still prevails because our society has still not learnt the importance of equality of genders. A major role in raising the pride of a nation can be made by this population as economical and scientific advancements comes as a subject to education of all its minor population. 

If the scenario continues, unemployment will become the devil troubling the youth. Even if there is employment, they will be the ones with lower incomes and with lower qualities of jobs. Illiteracy limits access to lifelong learning, professional development and ability to understand necessary information.

The government of the county has been influential in providing free education in most of the districts along with free meals in order to promote education, but sadly the ardent need for money in the family is not making some observable change. The Indian government launched the Right to Education act in August 2009, which describes the modalities of free and compulsary education for children 6 and 14 in India. Others are still under the regard of sending their girls to school. The condition of the government schools moreover is not in its best. Many schools still do not have proper infrastructure, and nor do they provide enough resources to be able to think outside of their dimly lit globe. 92 percent of government schools are yet to implement the RTE act. Unqualified teachers have also been on the prowl as it was discovered in Bihar in 2013 that a lot of the teaching staff was not rightfully qualified and others had simply paid for a job. Corruption at a level like this is not only demarking the future of billions of children of India, but also being able to abstrain them from dreaming. This suggests that by 2025, India will not be able to serve its population with proper jobs as jobs only grow with education and at an age like this, a person without a job irrespective of gender is not counted for!  

Education in literary sense does not only take into notice the being able to read and write notation, but it also introduces your persona, mental thinking and other correlated aspects to the worldly affairs. It introduces expressions, beliefs and attainment of strength required by the mighty individual who looks forward to achieve. Therefore, in order to grow it is important that the notion is discussed with outmost care and importance. India needs education, and the strive for it still continues.

Let's hope for a better and educated world. Let's hope for a better and educated youth. Let's hope for a better and educated elders. Let's hope for a better and educated India.

title: YET AGAIN.
description:
Woke up to see the sun above the horizon. The blazing light dazzled you there. The scorching heat and warm sand reminded, you were once again alive. But where were you? You don't remember the place but you sure do remember how it felt. The sun slowly sucking up your soul. The heaviness in your heart burying you deep into the sands. Your body infiltrating through the air, turning you into fragments of your soul which can't be coupled together again. You slept with your heavy eyes thinking the day tomorrow unravels would be a better one; but it isn't. It's just as yesterday appended with more new and lost thoughts. How can this be it? You were over that. No more the path to insanity, no more losing touch of reality. You cover it in the smiles and highs hoping for a better tomorrow but everything is gibberish. One whiff of nostalgia and you are back to square one. The one where it all began.

You begin to walk towards the horizon, carrying the shackles of your torment, pulling you back. With every step forward, the next step becomes more and more arduous. You still walk. You don't want to go back there. Don't want to feel all those things over again no matter how much tempting the good part be. You scream in wrath and start running, trying to leave behind the hands of the past reaching out to embrace you back in their arms. The sun starts to descend. You are searching for a new home or maybe a new world. You continue running with all your might. The past looked distant, you take a sigh; the sweat reminds you to give yourself a pat for the run, the pain in the legs is nothing compared to the bygones, the short breaths are better than the choking and sinking feeling you felt everyday. You sit down admiring the view, the journey. The sun,ready to set, is redefining crimson for you. You were in relief. You look back, the past inching closer  towards you at a speed much less than you can outrun it. You stop there and it'll come back for you, to take you back with it. With heavy eyes you lie down beneath the starry sky. Yet again, the sun shall rise. Yet again, you will fight. Yet again, you will run miles hoping for the better skies.

title: Notions on the wheels.
description: Landscapes, people passing me by. For few seconds it felt liberating, running away from all the chaos, only to meet a speed bump to bring me back to the reality. No matter how short the distance, travelling has an enormous power to drag you into a whirlpool of emotions. One second it feels like leaving everything behind, feeling liberated to the core; the next moment it feels like heading towards a strange and cold land, a tinge of sadness creeping inside you. The people you come across on roads have different stories to tell you. The woman carrying her baby in her arms and logs over her head tells she must be heading to light a fire, household chores must be running through her mind. The baby in her arms would be eager to reach home to quickly get into playing with the dust. The man on the shop must be tired of selling only to know he hadn't made enough for the day. A hope for a better tomorrow must be the driving force for him to work hard everyday. The truck drivers passing us by have a whole different story to tell. Days have passed and they haven't seen the doors of their homes. The night keeps them busy but the day would remind them of the hustle going on in their houses. They too want to go home. Different people, different struggle, different stories. And here I am sitting in my comfortable seat, in an air conditioned vehicle wandering why certain people leave, why certain people don't live up to their words when some people still struggle for the food on their table. This leaves me with mixed emotions. I am sad for them, I hope they reach their homes and have ample food on their table everyday. On the other hand I am grateful for the life I am given and to the people who still are a part of my life. Hadn't I seen those people, I would have not known their stories; Hadn't I fathomed their struggle, I would have not felt empathetic; Hadn't I travelled, I would still be engrossed in self pity. I guess that's the astounding power of travelling, you'll never go back to being the same person you were before travelling. On the other side of travelling waits a newer and more wise version of you. Embrace it with open arms. It's something travelling gives you in abundance: YOU.

title: Heart Beat.
description: Where do you find your calm? Where do you find your solace? Where do you find yourself? I say, music. Music has an enormous power to bring out the best/worst/happiest/saddest/intrigued/dejected/elevated version of you. Music is like a madness to me. It can be your best friend and your worst enemy at the same time. A certain song can bring out some very specific memories. Maybe you wanted to forget those, maybe not. But now you are enriched with those memories. You listen to the song, you start to recollect missing pieces of your life. I think every thing in this world has a rhythm to it, why else would we have a beating heart?

title: Irony smirked
description:
Human Life Is A Strange Paradox. And Rationality Doesn’t Always Lead To The Optical Solution. This World Is Simply An Illusion Where Change Is The Only Constant. Let’s Consider Cognitive Biases. Let A Be A Person Who Was Used To Sell Tea In His Childhood. And B Be A Person Who Is An Engineer. For The Betterment Of Your Country Whom Will You Vote If Both A And B Contest In The Elections?                                                              9 Out Of 10 People May Choose B As Their Leader. But If I Say, I Had Considered A As Narendra Modi And B As Osama Laden. Confused? Education May Be A Manifestation For Perfection But Not A Criterion To Judge People. Unfortunately, We Live In A Society Where A Person’s Dress Or English Speaking Skills Are Used To Judge Him/her. Irony Smirked.

Seeing A Girl Is Shorts Made Them Consider Her A Sult. “Beware Of Animals” The Sign Board Said. That Night, A Four-legged Animal Dragged Down A Two-legged Animal And A Girl’s Modesty Was Saved. While She Was Being Attacked, EVERYBODY Refused To Help Her. And The Next Very Day, The Same EVERYBODY Were On Roads Mourning Over Her Doing Candle March. Irony Smirked.

“L I V E T O G E T H E R”

The Board Read. Some Took It As LIVE TOGETHER While Others Considered LIVE TO GET HER. Life Is Simple If We View It The Way It Is And Not The Way It Could Be. No One Knows Why COW Is Sacred In One Religion And A Food In The Other. No One Knows Why “Bhagavad Gita” And “The Quran” Kept In The Same Book Store Never Fought But The People Following Them Did. And The Almighty Smirked.

They Took Pledge: “All Indians Are My Brothers And Sisters”. They Raped One Of Their Sisters And Fought Against A Brother From Other Religion Declaring “No Intolerance”. Had There Been Someone, Who Could Have Made Him Understand That Love Exists Among Brothers And Not Tolerance, Then Things Would Have Been Different. But The IRONY Is, Only After Breaking Souls People Realize How Much They Loved It.

And Both IRONY And ALMIGHTY Smirked.

title: 4 THINGS THAT AN EMPLOYER LOOKS FOR IN A PROPESCTIVE EMPLOYEE
description:
I really wonder on some days if we can define an ideal candidate for the job. People are always worried whether their qualifications are good or they look presentable or is their communication skill is okay enough. There are a number of skills that an employer looks for in job applicant. Subjects like qualifications and capabilities are high on the check list of the recruiter but they also look for other characteristics, which are given equal importance in today’s world.  It doesn’t matter which industry you are in, an employer is always in search of these traits:

1.       Team Work- An employer looks for a candidate who can adjust and work well in a team.  It involves getting along with other members to accomplish the task for the benefit of the organization.  They look for candidates who can work with others as it increases performance, develops unity and enhances organization culture.  Team work is an important part of the learning process.

2.       Uniqueness- An employer looks for a candidate who thinks out of the box and has the ability to present their unique ideas. As a candidate you should be able to convince the recruiter why he should higher you over other candidates. You should be able state you’re USP, i.e. Unique Selling Point.

3.       Commitment- An employer seeks for committed employees who will stick with the company for a long period. An employee who is committed would be willing to go an extra mile for the company to accomplish the task at hand. Commitment towards a particular job shows candidates’ passion and determination for the future tasks. A committed employee is very important for the success of the organization.  

4.       Personality- It is difficult to stand out among hundreds of people, so a person who has a great personality can bring a big difference the atmosphere at the workplace. The attitude that a person carries to an organization or an interview room plays a key role in selecting a candidate. If a person is self motivated and has positive attitude, he/she can create a positive environment in the office. They boost team spirit when in crisis or falling apart.  A self motivated person is always positive about his performance and motivates other members as well to give their best.

 

There is no such thing like an ideal candidate or an employee, but these are the basic check points that the employer looks to tick off when looking for a prospective employee.  It is important that you show these qualities to your potential employer, as it makes you more attractive and preferred choice. Don’t be afraid to ask any query. You should freely ask area that they think you need to improve and how you can you do so. Work on any shortcomings. Be confident and give your best.

title: Reality We Can All Relate To
description:
I was sitting on a bench of a bus stop at the road side. The noise of traffic, hundreds of vehicles, thousands of people and Me.
With a cigarette in my hand i looked through the smoke that offered a blurred vision of my own vision. The vision spoke to me. Even after all that noise i could hear what it was trying to tell me. It is in the moments of solitude that you can discover yourself.
I was restless, yet completely at peace. I could not imagine a world without all that noise surrounding me. My own world in this big universe existed. But, who cared? Who cared for a person sitting alone on a bench at a roadside?
Yes, i wasn't alone you see, but not a single person there, for there for me and neither was i for anyone. Therefore i wrote. I wasn't lonely, i had myself. In that smoke of cigarette i could see the person i was with, the blurred vision of my own Reality.

title: The Most Frequent Question
description:
What is your passion?
You must have come across this question a lot many times. In an interview, by your parents, colleagues, etc. Every time after being asked, you ransack your mind as to what an impressive answer should be. 
Even to me, this question has appeared in the most unfavorable times possible. I used to change my answer according the particular situation. We laugh at this but, it is true that by every passing year our goals change. These are obviously the different phases of our lives. Gradually, we must realize that in search of our passion we are doing nothing but, wasting our time. When we must be exploring the world, we simply sit on a couch and wonder, "what my passion could be?"
This is the worst you can do with yourself. You need to come out of it, apply your brain, do whatever life has to offer and then wait Wait for your passion to come to you. In the struggle to pursue what we really need, we simply forget who we are as people. Passion is nothing but who we are. I agree that life is a race but, that race is not with others. It is with oneself. You need to pursue yourself in order to identify your passion.

title: Andy Murray-the unabashed leader
description:
For long, Britain was known as the land of cricket. It gave birth to cricket and played a lot of cricket in the late 19th and early 20th century against Australia and West Indies. Then, the situation improved and football as well as few other sports gained recognition and fame in and around UK. But the real impact came in the 21st century when a certain Andy Murray started hitting strides in the world of lawn tennis. Although, he was from Scotland yet, he was being seen as someone who would make a name not only for himself but also for the country though the road ahead was not so easy as he had to face a lot of difficulty in rising up the rankings. But, in 2016, Murray showed that he had that extra bit of inspiration and will to go that extra mile and claim the top ranking in Men's Singles division of Lawn Tennis. He had worked very hard to be in this position and would leave no stone unturned in sitting at this position for a long time.

For the past 7-8 years, Men's tennis was ruled by the Big Four viz., Federer, Nadal, Djokovic & Murray. Federer and Nadal had been there for a long time and hence, had started to show signs of fatigue and age. This made way for Djokovic to rise up the rankings and ultimately grab the top position from Federer back in 2011, although he did slip up but it was only for a short period of time and he again returned to the top. But, for Murray, it was a case of so near yet so far. He could not make it to the top in spite of Federer and Nadal being down with injury and age-related issue leading to a dip in fitness. He came close to it yet couldn't achieve it but in 2016, Murray finally proved everyone wrong and did what he had been destined to achieve somewhere down the line. This, indeed, was a spectacular year for the British player as he had worked tremendously hard on his fitness as well as mental regime.

Starting with Australian Open, he could not overcome the challenge of Djokovic and had to settle for the runner's up title. The same story repeated at the French Open where he fell short against Djokovic once again. But, at Wimbledon, he showed to the world that it is quite difficult to beat him at his home and registered a win there and also went on to win the Gold Medal at Rio Olympics, 2016. After this, he went on to win two Masters Titles at Shanghai & Paris and lastly, the season ending World Tour Finals too. This win gave the world a message that Murray had finally overcome his mental toughness and is ready to rule the world of tennis.

title: MARRIAGE AND GIRLS-a deep truth & some unanswered questions
description:
"What are you up to these days?" one of my friends asked me when I met her after 5 years. "Nothing much. Just waiting for the right man to get married to." I replied. She was shocked by my reply and immediately asked in astonishment, "Are you sure? Do you think it's the right decision?" I said, "Yes, I feel it's the right time get married." "So why did you go abroad and did your masters, when you had to do was get married?" she asked. "Look, this is how it goes here", I replied.

This is how it lives progress. We are brought up in a very sophisticated manner, taught in good schools, given invaluable lessons of life, allowed to go abroad and do higher studies, and finally what happens is, we are married to someone and then the rest of our life is spent in serving and adhering to in-laws and their orders away from home We leave our home and the people that were a big part of our upbringing and move to a new house, a new neighborhood, a new society, completely devoid of any kind of  support. We have to adjust and adjust and keep adjusting for the rest of our lives. We aren't allowed to speak in between the elders nor are we allowed to argue with our in-laws. Our views are not considered when taking some important decisions. It's like we exist but only in a materialistic way.

But people don't see our sacrifices. We, girls, do a lot for our in-laws. We treat them as our own parents, even though we are not related to them by blood. We consider their houses as ours, a home away from home. We adjust in an unknown place without speaking a word. We respect and value their traditions and culture. We care for them like our parents and siblings. We leave the comfort of our homes. We change ourselves for them. We don't get to talk to our parents for days, but still we remain silent. We are entitled to all the rights what boys get.

But what do we get in return for all these favors or sacrifices? We still have to bring dowry after marriage. We are still not allowed to work even after having very good qualifications. We still have to follow certain dressing sense. We are still being sexually assaulted by our in-laws. We get beaten for not adhering to the orders of in-laws or if we argue with them. And all these are done in the present scenario where we boast of being very open-minded and support women-empowerment.

Why don't these rules/restrictions apply for the son-in laws? Why is it that the son-in-laws don't have to face such problems when they come to our home? Why is it that the son-in-laws can freely talk to our parents and also argue with them if need be? Why is it that our parents have to treat their son-in-law in a special way? These are the questions that need definite answers and it's needed soon.

title: OUR MOST NEGLECTED FRIEND- ENVIRONMENT
description: How many of you out there really care for our environment? Well its sad to say, the number is too small. People are dominating the world; using every single means to get their dreams and needs fulfilled, regardless of thinking how their activities might affect the surroundings. Deforestation, Global warming, Acid rain, Bio-diversity loss, Environmental pollution, over-population, excess of dumped waste....ewww...gross! Guess we might need an never-ending note to chalk them down relentlessly. Scary! Retrospect, I had a friend who believed that our Earth's resources are plenty enough for human use, so why care if there are only long term environmental-repercussions. He argues that since the consequences aren't estimated to give immediate side effects, there is no need for people in the present to care about them. I must say for sure he has a devil's advocate viewpoint if only I was able to make him comprehend that the "present-sparse" trees will soon be available to see only in Internet and books, for say, as pictures because of their debilitation as a result of man's after-effects. Its too egotistical to not think of the future generations. As an Under-grad in Engineering, to the best of my knowledge, Earth is the only planet where all the species can survive. If its gone, there would be no where else left for us to go. Well friends, time has come to define our immediate environment. Diligently, we have to coagulate our thoughts into reality in the long run. The best, to-the-point quote for this situation might be as follows, "We are not inheriting the Earth from our fore fathers. Rather we are borrowing from none other than our own children". Hope we join our hands together and unitedly save our inevitable friend. Be a thinking folk, not a robber baron.

title: Teenage Pregnancies, Sex Education Is The Need Of The Hour.
description:
Teenage pregnancy is a pregnancy in females at the age of 13-19 years. It has become a major concern in many leading countries. It is something that is affecting over a million teens worldwide. It is therefore very important to find the root cause of this issue. The cause of teenage pregnancy is not solely the fault of the individuals involved. There is a heap pf other causes that lead to this situation.
 The major element being the ignorance of parents/guardians towards educating their children about sex and the consequences that come with it. Parents usually shun their children's curiosity to learn or know about sex/sexual activities. According to them, ethics direct to keep such things away from children until they reach a certain age. Sadly,if curiosity is not cultivated properly,drifts to other implicit sources( friends,images,and the internet) to quench its thirst for knowledge. Such curiosities, unfortunately, end up having adverse impacts on both the family and the life of the teenager. 
According to the statistics, 85% of the pregnancies are unplanned. Teenager's willingness to experiment is the major cause for an unplanned pregnancy. There are also many other reasons on the individual part. For instance, the urge to participate in 'cool/fun activities' like drinking,smoking,drugs largely influence  this social matter. During adolescence, teens are hugely influenced by the social media, movies, and of course, their peers. They blindly follow the herd and do not want to be left out. Little that the teens realize, the never-ending chain of problems that they unknowingly welcome into their lives. 
Other than the numerous health problems that become a part of a teen's life, not being able to continue with their studies becomes one of the long-term implications. The teens are suddenly loaded with responsibilities they were not prepared for and well surely, cannot escape from either. 
It is very important that the teens are given adequate information about their pregnancy options before they make a decision. Parent's support make a huge difference in situation like this. However, the parents go through a wide range of emotions, from shock and disappointment to anxiety and worry about the future of the newborn and its mother. How bad the situation be, parents should not leave kids alone as they would need them more than ever. 
To sum it up, teen pregnancy is an alarming issue that needs to be prevented as much it can be. Sex should not be made, 'a-cannot-be discussed' topic, a taboo. Children should not be protected from sex talks or subjected to ignorance, rather be allowed to openly talk about it. Don't they say that prevention is better than the cure?!  It is better to talk about it instead of making your children have misconceptions and wrong ideas about something that can have negative outcomes in the future. 
Now it's up to you, either acknowledge them, or turn them a blind eye!

title: Electricity:- A journey from "helping hand" to "need"
description: This article is about how dependant we have become on electricity. Electricity was invented to help human beings to create a better future, but back then, people didnt think about who will be benefiting from this, people or earth or both. From the day of invention of electricity till now, we can say that, humans have used it to make his living better, without considering how it is affecting earth and its environment. Electrcity has a direct and also an indirect impact on nature. Direct impact invlude, building of dams which obstruct the natural flow of rivers which results in drought in some places, also huge gallons of water is used to creat this electricity, even though the water is not wasted but course of river and water flow is changed and that affects nature. In this age everything runs on electricity, light bulbs, cell phones, and many more things. We all know that we cannot stop using electricty but we can atleast find a way to create electricity which will not have any effect on nature and it would be great if we could solve some problems that our mother earth is having, using electricity.

title: The meaning of life.
description:
Life, as we know it, is arguably the most mysterious thing on this planet. 
We've come a long way from apes and yet to this day we don't know the meaning of life, why are we here, who made us, why would someone make us or is it just mere co incidence? some religions have the answer to all these questions, but doesn't really answer all of the questions, maybe religions like to keep an air of mystery around itself.
The meaning of life is different with every people, one would say it is to serve our god, the other would say that it is to serve our parents, serve our kids, serve others. but is that all we are here for? to serve people? the answer, if you ask people will be very subjective and will vary with people. some would say serving isn't all that we are here for and I think that's part true. I think the meaning of life is to enjoy the journey of life itself. if you didn't then you're missing out on everything this life could've given you but didn't take, you should serve and make other's lives beautiful too, but sometimes, just sometimes; it's okay to be selfish and live for once. 
You make your meaning of life.

title: Mind over magic.
description:
Why is one person sad and another happy? Why is one fearful and other full of confidence? Why is one a great success and another an object of failure? Is there an answer to these questions in the workings of your conscious and unconscious minds? 
There most certainly is. 

As opposed to what many people think, it is nothing else that brings an answer to an individual's prayer but how his mind responds to the mental picture or thought in his mind. 
This law of belief forms the basis of all the religions in the world. 

You have a treasure house of riches within you, all you have to do to gain them is open your mental eyes.
A magnetised iron will lift twelve times its own weight but if demagnetized, it will not even lift a feather. 
Many people are unaware of their potential and hence fail to draw it forth. 

If you suggest your Subconscious prior to sleep, "I want to get up at 6 A. M.", It will awaken you at the same time. 

You are like a captain navigating a ship. You must give the right orders, or the ship is wrecked. 
Your Subconscious mind takes you at your word. The law of life is the law of belief. 

Your Subconscious mind does not argue with you. 
You have the power to choose. Choose life! Choose love! Choose health! And above all, choose happiness!

Begin to think from the standpoint of the eternal truths and principles of life and not from the standpoint of fear, ignorance and superstition. 

Whatever your conscious mind assumes and believes to be true, your Subconscious will accept it and make it happen. 

So, you are literally the magic of your own wand.

title: DO WE EARN TO CHOKE?
description:
DO WE EARN TO CHOKE? 

It is a common life that we humans have. We are born, raised, enter school, high school, slog till we clear the competitions, go to college, strive for jobs, compete for positions and respect, and then expect ourselves to be settled down. We wreck in order to become profound industrialists, leaders and servers, contributing to human welfare and further become potential resources for everyone. But in the process do we really give a thought to how we manage to strive through life and it's obstacles that bang upon us? Never do we bother to think of serving the  one because of which we have prior existence. The complexity in our body, the life present around, all rests its prime in the air present around us. 

The air around us is responsible for sustaining every cell present in our environment. But as recent events be told, we did happen to see the conditions in Delhi and elsewhere  the day after the auspicious festival of Diwali. This was recognised as a matter of great concern as it saw an upliftment of air toxicity by about eight Times it's safe limits. The dust particles, the more minute they get, the more harm they cause, and tallying recent reports it has been observed that such matter has had an effective increase over the years. It directly results in the changing of various earthly phenomenons such as that of ozone layer depletion or the disturbances in the hydrological cycle. The more of these dust particles the more impact they have on lungs. Industries such as that of minerals have contributed in their buildup. The construction which we humans so dwell on for our activities has only led to us becoming more prone to the diseases which have been prevailing.

Living in these conditions and breathing in polluted air is as harmful as scorching yourself in a drain. Every child born today feels a sudden impact on his lungs as it comes out of its mothers womb. It is terminated to likely possess a smokers lungs illegitimate of that he has only just entered the world and has not even laid his eyes on worldly needs. With such growing evils, are we really willing to risk the lives of the generation that has already been born or is yet to be born? 

Air, so important to us is now the devil in the carnet. But still are we willing to give up on ourselves just because we wish to have the best quality of clothes or the best quality of homes? Trees that in true sense are being slaughtered are actually the men that guard us of the evil black smoke and gases. But because our brains have become so occupied  with our greed, we do tend on killing our own protectors. It is important now that we realise that by harming our flora we do harm Only to ourselves and we humans may not healthily last long for maybe another half century if this continues. 

Students nowadays have the environmental education introduced in their course. This subject is right on spreading the message on what we humans are tending to do, but at the same time it is not being taken on in practical life. Schools need to encourage plantation drives, and eco friendly manners of living. Alternative sources need to be used and workshops need to held to enlighten others who are unaware of the situation. Industries need to take proper measures in filling their residual content with particulate deactivators so that there is no direct harm done. 

It is important that we plead to ourselves that if we want to fulfill our needs, we do not fulfill them at the cost of the environment. Our children are yet to stay here and so are theirs. Selfishness has never done anyone good and nor shall it continue on doing. It's a right to everyone globally to breathe clean and it's a right the environment has to stay clean and green.

title: Demonetization: The other side of the coin
description:
This Fight With Black Money Is Not A 100m Race, It’s A Long Marathon We People Have To Run To Get Rid Of That. “The Sun Never Sets On The British Empire”. If We Replace ‘British’ And ‘sets’ With ‘black Money’ And ‘rises’, It Used To Suit Better Until Demonetization.

 In Bhagavad Gita, Lord Shri Krishna Had Said, “Although Millions Will Die In The War (Mahabharata), But The Sacrifices Are Small To Re-establish Truth And Justice.” So, Can’t People Withstand The Pain For Some Time To Have A Better Nation??

 From 8th November, No One Noticed Violence, Terror Activities, Sleeper Cells Activities And Even Our Paradise Which Every Morning Wakes Up With The Sound Of A Bomb Has Been Going Smooth From Past Some Weeks. So Just Imagine, Is It People Doing This Or The Money What Makes Them Do That??

When For The First Time, Any Inventions Take Place, Its Initially Difficult To Adjust To It. 100 Years Before Who Had Guts To Travel With The First Planes Or Trains. Maybe At The Present Cashless Scenario To Get Rid Of “shortage Of Money” Sounds Ridiculous As Most People Don’t Have Phones Or Accounts Or Cards To Access But As Said It’s Just The Beginning Of A Long Marathon. After All, “necessity Is The Mother Of Inventions”, So Things Will Be Taken Care Of. It’s Very Astonishing To Know That Even A Small Shopkeeper Is So Aware Of Cashless Economy That You Can Find Him Using Paytm Or Freecharge For Transactions. This Is The Win Over Social Prejudice.

 Once Transactions Are Done Digital, The System Might Seem Crystal Clear And No More Corruptions Can Take Place Easily. But It Will Certainly Take Time. If People Saw Congress Ruling For 60 Years With No Major Economic Change, People Can Tolerate The Man Who Is Working Days And Nights For Our Country.

description:

title: ASH-WIN
description:
Ravichandran Ashwin, the Indian offspinner, was named the Cricketer of the Year and the ICC Test Cricketer of the Year 2016 by the International Cricket Council for securing up 72 wickets from 12 Tests this year, turning into the third Indian cricketer to win the honour after Dravid in 2004 and Gautam Gambhir in 2009. Ashwin clinched up 48 wickets in eight Tests this year at a stunning average of 15.39 furthermore contributed with the bat by scoring 336 runs, averaging 42 amid the voting time frame from September 14, 2015 to September 20, 2016. Making advances on the constrained overs play he played just three One-Day Internationals in this period, the 30-year-old made his nearness felt in Twenty20 Internationals, where he grabbed 27 wickets at an average of 15.62 and a wonderful economy of 6.29. With the sublime figures with the bat and additionally with the ball in 2016 Ashwin sacked up first position in Test bowlers and all rounders. His diligent work made his name in the Test team of the year

A portion of the important records broke by Ashwin this year were:

•             In his 37th Test coordinate, Ashwin turned into the speediest Indian bowler and the second quickest on the planet to achieve 200 Test wickets

•             Ashwin was likewise the speediest Indian bowler and fifth quickest on the planet to achieve 100 Test wickets, getting to the point of reference in his eighteenth Test coordinate.

•             He turned into the main Indian to take 50 T20I wickets. He is the most elevated wicket-taker in Twenty20 International cricket for India with 52 wickets.

•             On 23 August 2016, Ashwin snatched his 6th Man-of-the-Series Award, outperforming the tie by Sachin Tendulkar and Virender Sehwag, and in just his thirteenth Test arrangement, and eighth arrangement where he played each Test.

•             On 10 October 2016, Ashwin took his twentieth five wicket pull, making him the third quickest to come to the landmark.

•             On 27 November 2016, he finished a twofold of 500 runs and 50 wickets in 2016. He is the second all-rounder from India to accomplish this in a solitary schedule year

title: Tipu Sultan
description: Tipu sultan(1750-1799) was a moslem ruler and the most powerful among all the native Indian prince. He was also known as tiger of mysore who conquered the kingdom of mysore, he was the eldest son of sultan Haider Ali of mysore. At the age of 17 tipu was given an infinite charge of importance in consular services. He was his father’s right arm and helped in victories indulging and supporting his father haider Ali and appear to be most powerful leader in southern India. Haider died in 1972 during the second anglo-mysore war, after which tipu was very efficient in upbringing of west coast under his succession. After this Tipu continued to battle until English were forced to make peace with him. The end of sultan was very brave, in 1799 east India company again joined with the Marathas and the Nizam’s and attacked the mysore territory, which made him pushed back to his capital and detained, fighting to the last mysore fell in the hands of English.

title: REAL-LIFE MONSTERS : Understanding Mental Illnesses
description:
We've all grown up hearing scary stories from our daadis  and naanis. We've read a lot of books, and watched hundreds of movies that revolve around these monsters. We know that a zombie's bite is infectious, and a siren's voice is alluring, a vampire's personality is charming, while a witch's curse is binding. We have done an extensive 'research' on these monsters, though we know they're all just figments of peoples' imaginations.
 
We however, are quick to disregard the existence of real monsters - the ones that live inside our heads! 

Statistics show that around 20% of people suffer from mental illnesses, and around 5% of them show a severe diversion from reality. This happens not because of a singular reason, but a myriad of causes. These illnesses, unlike physical ailments, may often go undetected as the symptoms are almost always invisible. We are unable to detect the bite of depression, or the curse of anxiety. We overlook the minute changes in personality, which turn out to be just the tip of the iceberg. 

Even if some of them try to share things with their immediate people, they either get ridiculed, or do not get the support they need. This results in the person suffering from such illnesses to withdraw themselves from the society, and grow further apart from reality. These people are harmless to others, but they themselves get stuck in a loop of self-doubt, depression and shame. A very few of such people actually receive help, and are able to overcome or learn to live with these illnesses. Many of them suffer silently until they can, and when the pain becomes too much to bear, they resort to unhealthy ways, like self-harm, abuse, or crime! 

To save them from such outcomes is a responsibility, we all must collectively bear, as a society. We must always be vigilant of our loved ones, specially the ones with prolonged cases of depression, or having suffered some traumatic event, or maybe the ones that seem to show a lot of mood swings. We should try to steer them away from negativity, and create an atmosphere where they feel comfortable. 

This would give rise to a better society as a whole. After all, an object is only as strong as its weakest point, and if we need to make it stronger, we need to focus on bettering the weaker points. Together, you and I can fight these real-life monsters, through determination, and positivity!

title: Can 3D Printing Change The World?
description:
The stages of development that the human being has achieved could not have been possible without the advancement of technology. Today, we're living in 2017 where our world has changed in various ways providing efficiency and quality to our lives. 
One of the hottest technology trends in the tech world, gaining a lot of hype, and is being used by many leading industries is the 3D printing technique. 3D printing stands as one of the apposite technology innovations that have and continue to evoke excitement and amazement among the various settings across the world. It implies to the process of creating physical objects from a 3-dimensional digital model. With the rate at which this technology is evolving, 3D printing is certainly one of the most promising technologies that would probably change the world as we know it. 
Architects are using 3D printing to save time when making scale models. With this, there will be no limitations to their designs as the construction companies will now be able to build their own parts of the building.  Also, with the growth in this technology, it will now become possible to print items with moving and working parts. The industries like the automotive industry and the aerospace industry will largely advance with this development
The thrill caused by this technology is best experienced by the dental and the medical field. Dentists are using this technology to print dentures using x-rays and scans to perfectly match them with their patient's sample. In the medical field, it has been used to successfully print the bone fragments, specifically part of a skull and a jaw bone. 
The most interesting fact is how it is being used in the fashion industry. Designers are making use of this by printing wild looking clothes, shoes, jewelry, and head ware. With these printers getting more common in our household, we would be able to do the same. How exciting would that can be?! There is just not these things that will advance with the 3D technology. Other fields like, the military, culinary, food industry, housing, fine arts and much more will boost with the strengthening of this industry. 
It is perceivable that 3D printing is indeed a game-changer and its use will definitely help change the economics of the various industries. But the real question is, Are we ready to make it a part of our everyday lives? What do you think?

title: WRITE YOUR HEART OUT...
description:
There are times when we are so overwhelmed with the things that happen in our life, that we wish to catalog and treasure them forever. These days people do so, is by clicking pictures. Though a picture is definitely worth a thousand words, there is a different way altogether in which words impact a person.

One may marvel how you can write millions of things in thousands of different ways, using just a few letters in any language. How is it that people explain their deepest secrets, or ardent desires in the form of writing! How words just seem to flow when you feel like expressing your feelings, or conveying your fears! Words have the power to transform a person's mood, or take their breath away.

Treasuring your memories in the form of a picture may give you a chance to reminisce about the particular day. But writing about it somehow captures how you felt, what you heard, what you saw, and what you did. It is amazing how an article just transports us somewhere else. 

We all know that somehow, movies never do complete justice to the books that they are based on. No matter how efficient the casting is, or how elaborate the graphics are, they almost always seem to fall short of fulfilling peoples' expectations. This isn't always because of the fact that things are simplified or just overlooked in the movies, but because each person imagines things differently. This is because writers always write their stories, but leave it to the readers to interpret the hidden meanings, or the clever innuendos. 

For me, writing is the easiest way to seek self-validation. Writing isn't an activity that I do in idle time, but something that I'm passionate about. It is the easiest way to explain what goes on in my mind, and to express my creativity. It is an outlet for my thoughts, and a haven for my anxiety.

I know that if I write my feelings in a diary, I won't be judged, I won't be answerable to have the opinions I have, nor would I be made to defend my views. Additionally, I can pick up my diary any day and get a thorough inventory of my life, which in itself is a reward to me.

title: Nelson Mandela
description:
Nelson Mandela in full Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela, byname Madiba (dark patriot and the primary dark president of South Africa) was born in Mvezo, South Africa on 18 July 1918. He was in the front line against politically-sanctioned racial segregation development in South Africa. In 1964 he was sentenced to life detainment and sent to Robben Island and discharged from the jail in 1990 following 26 years. In 1993 he was granted the Nobel Peace Prize (alongside F.W. de Klerk). From 1994 to 1999 he served as President of South Africa, he was the country's first black head of state and the first elected in a fully representative democratic election. His government focused on dismantling the legacy of apartheid by tackling institutionalised racism and fostering racial reconciliation. Ideologically an African nationalist and socialist, he served as President of the African National Congress (ANC) party from 1991 to 1997.On 5 December 2013 he passed away. In 2009, the United Nations announced 18 July—the day Nelson Mandela was conceived — as "Nelson Mandela International Day" in acknowledgment of Mandela's commitment to the worldwide peace and opportunity. The goal of observing Mandela is to spread the message that every individual has the capacity and the obligation to improve the world, in this way to manufacture a worldwide development for good. The day was propelled to perceive his commitment to the battle for popular government globally and the advancement of a culture of peace all through the world.

He said, "What numbers in life is not the simple reality that we have lived. It is the thing that distinction we have made to the lives of others that will decide the importance of the life we lead". On the off chance that everybody of us notices the call to just do great consistently, we would live Nelson Mandela's legacy and building a universe we had always wanted.

title: The Benefits Of Cloud Computing.
description:
What actually does Cloud computing mean? Is it something that we do after taking our computers to the mountains, sitting among the clouds? Or while being in an airplane ? NO. Then, what is Cloud computing? 
Cloud computing is, according to the Wikipedia, "the practice of using a network of remote servers hosted on the Internet to store, manage, and process data, rather than a local server or a personal computer." The term, "Cloud" in cloud computing refers to the architecture that takes the form of a cloud that is easily accessible to the users all over the globe. It is a concept according to which the programs run and give results in the window of a standard sub-browser in our PCs, and all the data and applications required for work are located on a remote server on the Internet. 
Cloud computing is a style of computing where huge scalable IT-related capabilities are provided as a service using the internet to the various external customers. Cloud computing has proven to be very beneficial for companies that chose to use its services. One of the benefits the that the cloud computing offers is that, it is very financially affordable. Because of which, the companies are able to save money and also avoid taxing-in-house systems. 
The basic categorization of the cloud computing forms are   IAAS (Infrastructure as a Service), PAAS(Platform as a Service), and SAAS(Software as a Service).
‘Cloud Infrastructure as a Service,’ also called Resource Clouds, provides the infrastructure resources as services to the end user. Virtualization of the server is the most important technology used in this service by the various providers. Cloud providers in this domain provide access to storage and data of different size and quality sticking to certain service level agreements. Amazon was the first company that started to offer a list of cloud services to the end customers. Amazon is,undoubtedly, the most popular vendor, providing different services,from platform to storage to databases. 
Cloud computing is drastically changing the behavior of the IT departments. It is true that, cloud if, and when executed will have a great impact. The idea of applications being run anywhere in the cloud is new to many of the application developers and software engineers.
The other desirable capabilities including scalability and lower costs, are very real. If you work in application development, expect the cloud to play a vital role for your future.
The next generation of application platform is here!
 of ds

title: Cycling to the road of Fitness
description:
In this modern world of competition, everyone desires to be physically fit and mentally sound.People , especially the youth have become very concerned about their health and fitness and owing to the fact they opt for various gyms and aerobics.
 While yoga continues to be the favourite, cycling too has gained attention of many folks. Cycling is one of those exercise which tickles most of the body parts. The advantages of cycling are numerous , improved blood circulation, better functiong of the respiratory system, strengthening of the thigs are a few of them. Apart from these one of the major advantage of cycling is that it is nature friendly and supports the sustainable development. 
Cycling has always been a centre of attraction due to its upper hand and additional advantages over other exercises. More and more people should be made aware of it's pros.

title: DREAM COME TRUE – 5G
description:
Technology is what craves us. Computer science is a diverse field. New technologies are being launched day to day. Many are the consumers of these technologies with few being the creators of this technology. These creators are having a very smart mind with thought process out of our reach.

Such a field of Computer science is regarding technology of speed. Speed is what attracts us. There were times we used 2g phones. And we were happy about it. There were times when Wi-Fi in phones was a new thing. Then 3g smartphones came up with quick networking features. It had a speed which soon became a necessity. And now are the trending 4g phones. The fourth generation brings up a speed that has saved a lot of time. But what if we get a faster network than this?

The fifth generation is soon about to enter into our lives. Yes, it will make our dreams come true. It’s not just a speed but a revolution. It will be faster than anything. Yes, the expectations are very high from this technology. It is expected to improve every possible case. It is about to have a vehicle to vehicle connectivity (V2V).

Let’s see how this generation conquers the previous one. The wait begins.

title: Pollution - A Threat to Environment
description:
Health is wealth. But are we taking care of it? Does health of one person depend only on him/her? Or it is dependent on each and every one of us? Well it depends on each and every person living on this planet. The topic of concern is the arising pollution.

Pollution is the contamination of our natural resources that cause very drastic effects to the environment. May it be Air, water, soil, land, noise, light or personal pollution the environment is getting affected. The environment we live in is no more pure. We are the ones who have contaminated it. Number of diseases nowadays is increasing and we are the cause to it. 

We smoke for pleasure, Throw away the waste on the roads for ease, play music at a volume higher than safe range for enjoyment. But is this all useful or rather I should say beneficial? It causes diseases at the end and nothing else.

title: BLACK LIVES MATTER
description:
It’s The First Century Of The 3rd Millennium “21st Century”. Education Is Our Priority. It Is Not Just The Means Of Survival But Also The Key To Knowledge, Awareness, And Intelligence. Yes, Education Provides All These But What About Implementation? Knowing Is One Thing And Implementing Is Other. Being Aware Through Books Is Of No Use If You Aren’t Following Or Implementing The Same In Your Daily Lives.

Even In The 21st Century Many People Discriminate On The Basis Of Cast, Creed, Race, Religion Etc. It’s Shocking To See That Not Just Uneducated People But Also The Educated Ones Do This. Who Are We To Discriminate And That Too On The Basis Of What?

These People Who Do This Kind Of Injustice Are Not Humans. They Have Stopped Realizing The Fact That A Person Before Being Black Or White Is A Human. Humanity Doesn’t Discriminate. Many Blacks Are Committing Suicides, Going In Depression, Feeling Bullied And What Not. Why Shall They Suffer? What Is Their Fault?

I Think We All Should Join Hands In The Black Lives Matter Movement And Make This World Equal And Just.

title: Artificial Intelligence
description:
What once was just an imagination in our minds is taking shape in real world day by day. Though we are still a few years away from having robots work at our wish and will, but Artificial Technology is already making a deep impact on our lives. Plainly, there will be some pains with its evolution but the positives of this technology are immeasurable.

AI is exhibited by machines. By the end of the decade, AI will be common in our daily lives, be it self-driving cars or a more accurate weather predictor.

But don't expect a complete machine takeover anytime soon. As easy it is for machines to self-improve under AI, what they lack is "the gut feeling", making humans an equally important piece of the puzzle.Thus, the best track will be to make both, humans and machines, live harmoniously with each other backing each other with it strengths.

While early sci-fi writers may have expected something more from the AI world at this stage, the rest of the world is satisfied with the pace of mankind's progress in the concerned field. After all, not everyone is ready for a robot as the next co-worker at the office !

title: Expressing thoughts
description:
As a man's heart is full of emotions, his mind is occupied by thoughts. A section of those people tend to 'Pen' them down.
"A pen is mightier than a sword" has been wisely said. Writing, apart from improving imagine and thought process also plays a role in improving the vocabulary and the knowledge of the particular language. Well that certainly is something like a cherry on top of a cake . Being an art in itself, it enhances personality development and is a major factor in imparting confidence to the writer.
The rich history of writing dates long back to the time when even paper didn't come to light. A numerous big folks have been associated and have earned praise from this art.
The beauty of this art is known better by those , who are linked with it . I've been indulged in it and it's really fun. It's never too late for this so give it a try.
