title: TOP 10 ESSENTIALS FOR FASHION STATEMENTS
description:
We all must agree that waking up every day and getting ready to go to college is a great hassle.
We all want to always look our level best at college and  so, deciding on what to wear is a cherry on the top of the this cake.
Well, no worries!
Here is a list of top 10 essentials for everyday college fashion statements:-

1) A Black Bag
It’s time for your age old school bags to go off for a break, spend some cash and get yourself well set for this very cool college trend.

title: 10  LESSONS  TO  TAKE  FROM  SCHOOL  TO  COLLEGE
description:
DEAR FRIEND, YOU ARE YOUR OWN PARENT NOW
I bet you say to yourself, 'Hey, I am so confused with life, I need some advice ' or 'Professor, I don't have a career choice yet...' or 'Mom, Should  I be a part of this cultural event?' or 'Dad, Is this dance my calling?' . In college, do you constantly call up your parents or professors for advice and always get an unsatisfactory response or feel that it's not enough. (SIGH) BUT....Congratulations, my friend, you have entered a world that treats you as an adult (apart from the customary morality speeches). Your well-wishers now will see you as a complete Mister or Missus, and given the generation gap they are perfectly correct for there is not much they can do now! College is when you come out of your little, frail and fragile cottage and enter the high-raised and emotionless offices. No one will identify abilities for you. Opportunities will not come to you served on a platter. Any workshop, competition or an idea you stumble on, do not look on your side for approval...mommy and daddy won't be right there. Instead you need to look back, for a nod and some emotional assurance only! So....it's the time you become your own parent. Thus making you capable in decision making which will help you a lot ahead in you especially professional life.

2.  DEAR FRIEND, TIME TO SAY YES TO EVERYTHING 
Even if you're the Mayan Calendar with all your dates and life documented and planned, you do not know where your career and life take you. So if any opportunity, person, responsibility, job, workshop, advertisement etc come your way... do not think twice about taking part. SAY YES!  It can take you to mountains, and down alleys and long winding pavements that you couldn't have imagined. Put yourself in the most uncomfortable positions if you have to for you will create stories to remember. Moreover it doesn’t hurt to experiment while in college coz after that you will not get chances to explore different sides of yourself. You will make mistakes you'll laugh at! If you have the annoying 'emergency break' tendency to pull the plug and no try something new, then you will remain in school. Is there a competition coming up?? GO. Is there an advertisement for this cool coding conference?? GO. See someone interesting in the bus? TALK!...Off with the emergency break....


3. It's OK
It's OK to feel whatever you feel and not know where you are going. Doubt, low confidence, self doubt, boredom, lust, confusion....Don't be hard o yourself....This is life, the climax is meant to be a suspense. Would AXN's Sherlock be fun if you knew the FINAL SCENE? Moreover these are the years where you can find the true you and no one achieved anything in the first try without making mistakes. 


4. BOARD MARKS DO NOT MATTER
This is one thing you will get to know as soon as you reach college and will make most of you happy. Are you disheartened with a 60% or are you super-complacent with a 96% ? Do not be. It's ONLY your ticket into the world of college and not your master stroke achievement. Your game has just started .No one made it big in life with the perfect board marks. Throw your petty report card into the non-recyclable trash can....it is not something that defines you for life! Venture out! Throw more colors and spices to the report card of life.

5.  CHOOSE COMPANY WISELY
College is where you make a life for yourself. Life love, friendships can make you or break you. You start making choices between booze or snooze, all-nighters or daily study, wrong and right...It is an impressionable age and you will not know how the environment of the people around seeps into you. Judgments people wisely and do not let them influence you! Or don’t crumble under peer pressure if you feel something is not right for you say NO, it won’t ruin your friendship and if it does and those people weren’t your friends at all. 

6. 5 SECOND RULE
If you are doubtful in any situation about 'To be or not to be' or 'To enroll or not enroll myself' or 'Talk to her or not talk to her'....if you marry the thought with an action within 5 second then, congrats the thought is still alive. Send yourself a text or write on your hand or even get up to enroll or talk! Since you have decided to say YES to everything, this rule will give you all the courage to let go off your demons,  baggage and inhibitions for those seconds. After that happens, you go with the flow soldier!

7.MASTER A NEW SKILL
Are you someone who doesn't have a particular hobby? Do you think you're too busy or too old now that you are a bachelor of a course?. If you are 18, fat, lazy or inflexible but have always wanted to do ballet....do not stop. You can do whatever you want hence add a new fresh skill to your kitty. It is something that plugs the boredom out of your college life and studies. Trust me, the time you spend on it will repay you with self discoveries and a unique skill set. And if you don’t try something new what the difference coming to college has even made, changes and experiments are necessary my friend to keep the thrill in life.

8.KEEP OLD SKILLS ALIVE
Skill...it's a nice little word. It keeps your tongue rolling and soul alive. You were a person in school you did a lot of singing , painting or tennis. Now in college, you call yourself 'old', you think, 'Hey, time to let go...I am too busy'. You are a WRONG and you are committing gross murder. Murder, of that part of your brain that keep you creative and colorful! Do not give into the monotony of studies and career, so to say. Keep the 'lalaasss' and 'hooolas' alive! A plus point of these skills can be they can be a great ice breaker especially when you are new in the college and looking for some friends having the same skills like singing or playing an instrument. Thus our OLD skills help in building NEW relationships. 


9.DON'T TRY TO DECORATE A RESUME
Sigh, the world and the student community is plagued by numbers. School life you are told that you should be a good student. You slowly tick through time trying to fill your report with impressive yet meaningless numbers. In college, you are told that 'CGPA is life' and your résumé has to be sparkling and alluring. Your résumé , my friend, does not have to be Nicole Kidman. Your résumé is prey to the 'unrealistic beauty standards' of this monotonous world, and do not get blinded by them! Take up jobs, participate in workshops etc. for your sake, not to paint your résumé for some random company to judge you by. You should also listen to your inner self and do things which you find interesting instead of just trying to live by the standards set by others. 

1O.CREATE MEMORIES
Memories create funny conversations, funny conversations keeps you younger. And young is good! You are a little restricted in school for you are a little puppy. In college, it's time you let yourself free and make full use of the freedom. if anything goes right, left or wrong..tell yourself that you are creating memories for a hearty laugh in the future, sitting by the fireplace fifty years from now with your glass of wine, family and dog. So wag your tails and seize the world by your paws!

title: Life Is as You Take It.
description:
Stories usually begin on this magical note, well. . . Not this one. 

Ever wondered how difficult it is to keep trying even though you feel like you cannot succeed?

Do you know the moment when you actually finally succeed? Have you felt happiness enveloping you in it’s arms?

A girl was born on Monday morning in an upper middle class Punjabi family when, the entire world was as busy as it can get.

She was no magical fairy or learned saint, she was as normal as they come.

All parents are excited for their child to speak his/her first word, walk, eat etc., so were hers.
Sadly when she spoke? 
She couldn’t complete her words.
Yes, she stammered.

She was bullied in school because of the same.

Fortunately, she had the support of her parents and after rigorous practice, she beat the jinx and grew up only to become a great debater in the inter-school tournaments on behalf of her school.

She realized the importance of parental support and the same made her wonder the condition of those who don’t get this basic privilege. 

Her Father taught her, "the old saying, nothing is impossible as long as you believe in it".
 She was now sure if it. 

Later in her life, when she was studying for class 12th, she lost her grandmother to cancer and a dear friend committed suicide because of the extensive pressure, soon she was losing herself in a black hole post that incident where she could see no light.

She was still determined to score well and 
 Somehow got back to her life and studies. 
She was still missing the way to find the light at the end of this dark tunnel.
She scored well and got into the line of English honours.

Later, somebody told her the only way to help herself is to help others.
She started volunteering for NGOs, working for suicide aid helplines and answering anonymous teen aid questions and this is exactly how she found her way into the light.

Today, her communication and debating skills shakes and turns many heads.
Her problem solving skills and her ability to be there in need have made her into a very positive and empathetic personality.

Wherever she stands in life, her family is proud of her, she hopes her friend and grandmother are proud of her too.

This girl? She is currently writing this.

I promise I’m being honest when I say that life always throws stones at you.
It is you, who has to find out how to shield yourself.

Life will have downs as well as ups, guess what? It’s best to just hold on tight and enjoy the ride.

title: "Saving Animals"
description:
"Animals"
     The Earth is big so we need to share it.. There Are Nearly 10,000 species of animals in the Earth and mostly Are Endangered Now...so what measures are to be taken to save the existing species.
 It is not that difficult to help them in surviving..There are some small tips which you can do and save them...Some of Them Are
1.Be a Voice For The Voice Less
    Speak out against any Injustice which Is Happening To Them Because The only difference between animal's and Human Beings Is that we can only talk And they don't so use the special power which you have to help the pity creatures when they are In need of you
2.Place a bowl of Water
     During summer place a  bowl Of water In your terrace,playing Area and sit outs so that the birds can drink The water and save themselves from the hot sun
3.Don't Waste Food
    Instead of throwing the excess food In dustbins provide It to the stray dogs and cats which helps them to survive
4.Animal Welfare Organization
      Be a part of  any animal welfare organization so that when you can help the organization when you are free
5.Have volunteers Numbers
     If you don't have time to take part In The organization atleast have some of The contacts and members who Are In organisations because when you find any animal which is injured or In need Of help you can ask them to come and take care of It
5.Dont Spray Pesticides On Lawns
  Don't spray any sort of pesticides And fertilizers because this may kill The harmless tiny Insects which are present Inside the lawns.
6.Drive Slowly In Highways
   When You Notice That There Are animals passing the roads..drive Slowly So that You don't hurt The Animals
    Apart from this there are Many Small things which you can do and Help the species To live
   "Live And Let Live"

title: Natural Sources of Vitamin for a Healthy Mind and Body
description:
Vitamins, like other types of nutrition is an important part of our diet that we need in order to keep our-self healthy and active. But, drug resistant to drugs areas common these days. so, looking toward nature for help can be a good idea. As the number of cases of mind related problems are increasing, it is becoming more important for us to have a good information on how we can protect our-self from mind and health related problems (or at least can minimize their effect) and in
some case we can even undo the health of affected peoples using some "short tricks". All we have to do is, just take care of the things we are taking as input and nature has abundance of items that can help us and one among them is taking Vitamin C. It is like the king of all the vitamins when it comes to improve our mental state.
Its benefits are:-
             -produces Neurotransmitters, which acts as a transmitter in between the neurons(our brain 100 billion neurons approx).
              Neurons control our moods, addiction, sleep, ability to focus, concentrate and remember(so you can imagine its importance).
             -Improves IQ, memory and other mental function.
             -Protect against age related problems like alzheimer's diseases, dementia and strokes.
But we have to take it in a limited quantity as "excess of every thing is bad, however better it is!". According to USDA, for men it is 75 mg per day for women and 90 mg for men and its important sources are:-
             Fruits - Citrus fruits, mango, papaya,pineapple,watermelon.
             Vegetables- Sweet and white potato, tomato, cauliflower and broccoli.
Next is, Vitamin D. And interesting thing about this vitamin is that for this, we don't have to invest money. All we have to do is just sit somewhere in a bright Sunshine and your skin will take care of rest of the things.It is proved by various scientist that
it is protective against cancer, diabetes, heart disease, high blood pressure and counting still goes. The usual rule is “20 minutes of sun twice a week” on a large surface area of your body, such as arms or legs, for adequate vitamin D formation.
One more is Vitamin B. Actually this is not one vitamin but a family of vitamins that have similar structures with some element being added or subtracted in place of some another element in order to produce a new member. And important members of this family are B6,B9(folic acid), and B12. 
They can improve energy levels and increase your tolerance to stress.The B vitamins can reduce brain aging, banish depression, and  can even help you live longer!
An important role of B vitamins for brain heath is in the production of the neurotransmitters serotonin, dopamine, and GABA. If you’re deficient in serotonin, you may suffer from anxiety, insomnia, low self-esteem, negative thoughts and SAD (seasonal affective disorder).Without adequate GABA (gamma-aminobutyric acid), you may find yourself easily stressed, overstimulated and overwhelmed.
Dopamine helps you get focused. Source of these vitamins:-
                 -Folic acid can be found in green leafy vegetables, legumes(pulses except arhar(tur)), fruit, eggs, and organ meats.
                 -The best food sources of vitamin B-6 are fish, poultry, bananas, carrots, spinach, peas, and potatoes.
                 -Vitamin B-12 can be found in all animal products — meat, fish, eggs, and dairy. 
So, keep a track of these things and you will be less prone to mind related diseases. Eat healthy and stay healthy.

title: "ENGINEERING MANIA"
description:
The word "engineering" defines innovation, creativity and things that are invented to make work easy. Our country have produced some legends such as Sir APJ Abdul Kalam and many more in the field of Engineering. Why does engineering have such an high level of importance in our society is what we are going to see in this article (sketched down by an engineer..irony). 

    In India there are almost 3,345 engineering colleges and 1.5 million engineers graduating each and every year. By looking at the numbers you can say that it's a myth in India that if you become an engineer you can do anything in your life. "Engineering first, everything next"

         So out of 1.5 million engineers  how many end up in their core field? The answer is just a handful. It's accounted that only 20-30% of graduates enter their field of engineering and pursue it as a career. Then where is the majority share of people who pursued Engineering? If we go and analyse the profession one ends up after completing their engineering, it's pretty shocking to say the least. Most commonly they end up doing MBA, startups, family business, sales and marketing, government employees, freelancers and what not. 

           Then why do they pursue engineering and study 40 subjects, hundreds of laboratory experiments,24 Internal Exams, 3 Mini projects, tons seminars and a final year project in their 4 years of engineering life. If people start deciding their area of interest in engineering prior enrolling into engineering we will definitely see a rise in graduates in their respective field for career going up by almost 50-70%. 

          So guys let's at least change this engineering mania and guide our next generation to pursue their dreams and explore the world as it is and study the various culture and many more things that are spread across the land filled area on the globe.

Please Do Leave A Comment

title: What am I going to do after graduation (CS/IT)?
description:
What Am I Going To Do After Graduation (CS/IT)? You Must Have Asked Yourself This Question A Tot Of Time, Even I Did. As We Progress Through College, Everyone Begins To Develop An Idea Of What They Want To Do With Their Life. But For Some Reason The Closer We Get To Graduation We Drop Those Dreams Due To Lack Of Proper Planning And Guidance. 

Let Me Tell You My Experience! I Always Wanted To Try Every Possible Field Of Career And Live Different Lifestyles And Yes! I Succeeded In Them With Sufficient Planning. I Will Try To Summarize A To-do List Which I Followed And Required For Following Four Possible Fields After Graduation.  

Private Sector Jobs: (Worked At Accenture And Intel)
• Select Any 2 Languages From C++/Java/Python/SQL/Android/C# And Excel In Them.
• You Should Have 3 Projects On Your Resume With Sound Knowledge Of Each One. Sponsored Project Gives You An Extra Plus. 
• Get Certifications. Visit Edx, Allison, Courseera.
• Participate In Coding Competitions And Exhibit Your Skills. Visit Hackerank, HackerEarth.
• Go For Industry Paid/unpaid Internships.
• No Need To Spend Time In Publishing Papers.
• Get Involved In Extracurricular Activities To Improve Personality Development And Communication Skills.
• Keep Your LinkedIn Profile Updated All The Time.

Academics Jobs: (Worked At NIT Surat)
• From The University's Perception, You Are Expected To Make Significant Or At Least Decent Contribution To Research. So, PG/PhD Is Compulsory.
• At UG Level, You Can Take A Glimpse Of Paper Publication And Conference Via Publishing In Local Journals/conference. 
• At PG Level, You Must Have At Least 2-3 Papers In Top Journals.
• Connect To People At BARC, IISc, ISRO, TRDDC Etc. By Attending Science Exhibitions At Respective Places.
• Sometimes You Work Really Hard But You Lose Opportunities Due To Lack Of Presentation Skills. So Take Participation In Paper Presentation Competitions From College Level To National Level.
• At Any Level Choose Guide And Problem Statement Wisely.
• Attend Conferences To Get Familiar With This Culture. Visit WikiCFP.

Government/PSU Jobs: (Selected As Assistant Manager At SBI)
• Job Hiring Is Done Via Competitive Exams And Cracking It Is A Great Achievement In Itself Considering The Selection Ratio. 
• Mostly There Are No Interviews And Even If There Are They Are Only HR, So It Doesn't Matter What Is On Resume Except Minimum Grade Criteria.
• These Exams Are Similar To GATE Which Mainly Focuses On Basics And Fundamentals. 

Being An Entrepreneur: (Coming Soon)
• This Is A Revolutionary Era For Digital World. Startups Are In Boom And It Is Worth A Try To Incubate An IDEA Into A Successful Startup. 
• Participate In Hackathons Which Is A Technical Event Where You Are Supposed To Build A Product From Scratch Within 20-30 Continuous Hours. It Is An Experience Of A Life-time, Absolute Bragging Rights, Opportunity To Network With, Learn From, Present To, And Innovate Alongside Awesome Peers And Industry Leaders.
• Spend Time In Understanding The Tech World And Customer Knowledge By Reading Different Articles, Answers, Opinions, Reviews.  Talk To Others And Ask Questions, Be Open Minded And Explore The People In Your Network.  Join And Become Active Member On GeeksforGeeks, Stackoverflow Etc.
• You Should Find Like-minded People. Search For Skills Not Friends.
• Start Publishing Small Apps/websites. Even A Small Appreciation To Your Work By Someone Unknown Will Give You Immense Pleasure And Motivation To Move Forward. 

That’s All Then!!! Keep In Mind, Whatever Decisions You Take Here Are Going To Shape Your Future. Please Write Comments If You Find Anything Incorrect, Or You Want To Share More Information About The Topic Discussed Above.

title: Women Transforming India, 2017 Breaking the glass ceiling - Recognizing women by Govt. India
description:
Submit your entries here :

https://www.mygov.in/task/women-transforming-india-2017-breaking-glass-ceiling/



The Theme For International Women’s Day, 8th March 2017, Focuses On “Women In The Changing World Of Work: Planet 50-50 By 2030”. This Advances The Government Of India’s Commitment To Ensure Gender Parity In India, With Special Focus On Women’s Economic Empowerment. India Has Taken Bold Steps Towards Creating New Opportunities Of Job Creation, Entrepreneurship, Skill Building And Access To New Industries Particularly ICT, Through Its National Initiatives Like Beti Bachao Beti Padhao, Skill India, Make In India And Digital India.

NITI Aayog’s 15 Year Vision Document, Which Will Replace The Five-year Plans In India, Also Proposes Key Reforms To Encourage Women’s Workforce Participation Across Sector In India. This Is Also In Line With The Achievement Of The Sustainable Development Goals Being Steered By NITI Aayog.

Achieving Gender Equality And Empowerment Of All Women And Girls, Rests Upon unlocking The Full Potential Of Women In The World Of Work. When Economies Are Geared Towards Achieving Women’s Rights And Gender Equality, The Benefits, Such As Fairer Societies And Greater Economic Growth, Accrue To Everyone.

In 2016, NITI Aayog, In Partnership With The United Nations India And MyGov, Launched The First-ever Women Transforming India, An Online Contest To Crowd Source Stories Of Women Making A Difference, In Form Of Essays. This Year Again, NITI Aayog Is Launching The Women Transforming India Campaign To Recognize Powerful Women Of India’s Workforce, Who Are Influencing Positive Change In Their Communities And Furthering The Government Of India’s Mission Of Inclusive Economic Growth.

Women’s Economic Empowerment In The Changing World Of Work Implies Not Only Empowering Female Entrepreneurs And Business Owners, But Also Recognizing Women’s Unpaid Care, Domestic Work And The Overwhelming Majority Of Women In The Informal Economy.

This Year, NITI Aayog, Along With The UN In India And MyGov, Launches The Campaign To Award Inspiring Women From Across India Through Entries In Two Categories:

1. Short Video And Photo Contest On Women Breaking Gender Stereotypes: This Can Be A Homemade Video Shot On The Mobile Phone. Both Photos And Videos Are To Be Accompanied With A Short Caption (not Over 50 Words) Encapsulating The Story Of The Woman.

2. Written Entries Of Women In The Workforce, Across Sectors, Irrespective Of Their Educational Qualifications. We Encourage Stories Of Women Working In Non-traditional Occupations And Women Who Are Working To Empower Other Women, Their Neighborhoods/society In Anyway. (Stories Should Not Exceed 500 Words.)

Participants Are Invited To Upload Entries Directly On The MyGov Platform.

The Last Date For Submission Of Entries Is 1st May, 2017.

Click Here To Read The Guidelines And Evaluation Criteria.

title: BTS: The First K-Pop Group To Be Nominated For BBMAs
description:
Now, for all those who are not familiar with K-Pop, here's a brief introduction: K-pop is Korean Pop music.

For those who are familiar with K-Pop or just Korean music in general, this article will probably make more sense and will be more entertaining. Although it might be an interesting experience for the newcomers too.

Anyways, with the Billboard Music Awards coming up, all the nominated artists are gearing up and the fans are hoping for a win for their favorite artist. While there's a battle going on between famous artists like Justin Bieber, The Chainsmokers and others, this Korean boy group called Bangtan Boys or more commonly known as BTS, has climbed their way up to the list of artists nominated for the Top Social Artist Award.

Before anything else, a little bit about BTS:

Bangtan Boys, also known as BTS, is a seven member South Korean group that was formed in 2013 under BigHit Entertainment. The Leader, Rap Monster, along with two other members of the group, J-Hope and Suga, are the rappers of the group and members Jin, Jimin, V and Jungkook make up the vocal team. But that's not all. While all of them dance quite fantastically, members J-Hope, Jimin and Jungkook contribute a lot to their choreography.

The Bangtan Boys started out as a hip-hop group but through the years, they have explored and experimented with other genres as well. Aside from their sick music, the lyrics of their songs are one of the main reasons for their ever-growing fan following. They write about what the youth of this generation is going through. From relationships to hard times in one's life, BTS beautifully delivers the truth without sugar coating anything. And that's why the fans relate to their songs so much.

Their fandom which is named A.R.M.Y. went crazy when they found out that BTS was nominated for BBMAs. This is a big deal for a lot of reasons. A few of them are:

1. BTS is the first ever K-pop group and the second Korean artist after Psy to be nominated for BBMAs.

2. BTS is a fairly new K-Pop group in the Korean music industry as compared to other senior groups since it has only been 4 years since the group was formed.

The fans are eagerly waiting for the voting to start on May 1 so that they can get BTS the win they deserve.

Being a BTS fan myself, if they do win (and I hope they do), I think it is going be a great accomplishment both for the fans and for BTS because despite knowing that they have a great fan following internationally and winning several Korean music awards, winning an award like the Billboard Award just establishes the fact that they are being acknowledged as great artists internationally too.

So, for those open to new music and new experiences, do check out BTS' Work. And for those who're already familiar with BTS, don't forget that voting starts from 1st May and let's do our best to get BTS their first Billboard Award. Fighting!

title: "A Brown Girl's Guide to Gender" - Aranya Johar - Unerase poetry
How Young Women Look at Sex?
description:
For several years now, we’ve been engaged in a national debate about sexual assault that is happening around us. No question, it’s crucial that young people understand the ground rules for consent, but that’s where the conversation about sex is ending and in that vacuum of information the media and the Internet are educating the younger generation for us. If we truly want young people to engage safely, ethically and enjoyably, it’s time to have open honest discussion about what happens after “yes” and that includes breaking the biggest taboo of all and talking to young people about women’s capacity for and entitlement to sexual pleasure.

A study says that despite the hype, teenagers are not engaging in intercourse more often or at a younger age than they were 25 years ago. They are engaging in other behavior, when we ignore that, when we label that as “not sex” that opens the door to risky behavior and disrespect.  Young women have lots of reasons for participating. It made them feel desired; it was a way to boost social status. Sometimes, it was a way to get out of an uncomfortable situation. 

Girls express a sense of shame around their genitals. A sense that they were simultaneously icky and sacred. Women’s feelings about their genitals have been directly linked to their enjoyment of sex.  Girls’ genital self-image is under siege, with more pressure than ever to see them as unacceptable in their natural state.  This started when women first started regularly shaving their armpits and their legs. That’s when flapper dresses came into style, and women’s limbs were suddenly visible, open to public scrutiny. There’s a way that I think that this too is a sign. That a girl’s most intimate part is open to public scrutiny, open to critique, to becoming more about how it looks to someone else than how it feels to her.

A psychologist at the University of Michigan, coined what is my favorite phrase ever in talking about all of this: “Intimate justice.” That’s the idea that sex has political, as well as personal implications, just like, who does the dishes in your house, or who vacuums the rug. And it raises similar issues about inequality, about economic disparity, violence, physical and mental health. Intimate justice asks us to consider who is entitled to engage in an experience. Who is entitled to enjoy it? Who is the primary beneficiary? And how does each partner define “good enough”? Honestly, I think those questions are tricky and sometimes traumatic for adult women to confront, but when we’re talking about girls. 

A girl goes into an encounter hoping that it won’t hurt, wanting to feel close to her partner and expecting him to have an orgasm, she’ll be satisfied if those criteria are met. There’s nothing wrong with wanting to feel close to your partner, or wanting him to be happy, and orgasm isn’t the only measure of an experience but absence of pain — that’s a very low bar for your own sexual fulfillment.

 Starting in infancy, parents of baby boys are more likely to name all their body parts, at least they’ll say, “here’s your pee-pee.” Parents of baby girls go right from navel to knees, and they leave this whole situation down the waist unnamed.

There’s no better way to make something unspeakable than not to name it. Then kids go into their puberty education classes and they learn that boys have erections and ejaculations, and girls have …periods and unwanted pregnancy. And they see that internal diagram of a woman’s reproductive system — you know, the one that looks kind of like a steer head.And it always grays out between the legs. So we never say vulva, we certainly never say clitoris.  

The only way that shift in thinking can happen though is if we talk to young people more about sex — if we normalize those discussions, integrating them into everyday life, talking about those intimate acts in a different way — the way we mostly have changed in the way that we talk about women in the public realm.

Now I know that’s not enough. I also know what I hope for our girls.

I want them to see sexuality as a source of self-knowledge, creativity and communication,despite its potential risks. I want them to be able to revel in their bodies’ sensuality without being reduced to it. I want them to be able to ask for what they want in bed, and to get it. I want them to be safe from unwanted pregnancy, disease, cruelty, dehumanization, violence. If they are assaulted, I want them to have recourse from their schools, their employers, the courts. It’s a lot to ask, but it’s not too much.

As parents, teachers, advocates and activists, we have raised a generation of girls to have a voice, to expect egalitarian treatment in the home, in the classroom, in the workplace. Now it’s time to demand that intimate justice in their personal lives as well.

title: FROM ROBOTIC TO SUAVE & GET GROUNDED: HOW TO IMPROVE YOUR SALSA BASIC STEP
description:
How To Improve your Basic Step On1 and On2

You’ve learned to step on 1,2,3 – 5,6,7. Check!

You’ve learned not to step on the 4 and 8 and “pause” on those counts instead. Check!

You’re starting to find that “1” beat, count salsa music, and mostly dance on time. Amazing!

Everything is going great, but after awhile you notice your basic isn’t quite like the dancers you drool over. It’s on time, but it looks robotic.

So how do you get from being a choppy looking robot to having smooth connection, beautiful body movement, crazy moves and amazing musicality like your favourite dancers? The first step is adding perpetual motion into your dancing.

Here’s an explanation from three-time Canadian Salsa Champions Patrick and Scarlet on exactly how to do it:

As I mentioned before, once you’ve “learned” something, you’re never really done. There’s always improvements to be made, and improving your fundamentals is what allows you to do all the wicked tricky fun stuff later on.
